instructions_to_main_agent.general: You are building 'Veritas AI', a professional, high-integrity interview platform. The design must feel like a 'Control Room' - dense, data-rich, but calm. Avoid generic SaaS gradients. Use the 'Grid Borders' style for cards.
instructions_to_main_agent.interview_room: The Live Interview Room MUST be in Dark Mode by default to reduce glare. Use 'Glassmorphism' for the controls overlay. The video feed is the hero.
instructions_to_main_agent.dashboard: Use the 'Bento Grid' layout. Do not leave large empty white spaces. Fill the grid with meaningful data visualization or 'filler' stats to maintain density.
instructions_to_main_agent.charts: Use Recharts or Shadcn Charts. Color code them strictly: Green = Good/Safe, Red = Risk/Alert, Blue = Neutral/Info.
instructions_to_main_agent.forms: Use Shadcn Form components. Customize the input borders to be 'zinc-200' in light mode and 'zinc-800' in dark mode. Add subtle focus rings.
instructions_to_main_agent.testing: Add 'data-testid' to ALL interactive elements (buttons, inputs, cards). Format: 'kebab-case' (e.g., 'start-interview-btn', 'candidate-name-input').

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
